intro: Astragalus giraldianus, commonly known as the Giraldian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, trifoliate leaves, and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Astragalus giraldianus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
